channel.title: Posts on Jake Waddle's Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jake Waddle's Data Blog

item.title: The Chargers and Close Games
item.description: Los Angeles Chargers Fandom I have been a Chargers fan for 20 years. Now that that’s out of the way can you think of a team, during the last few years, that has blown leads or made near-comebacks at the rate that this franchise has? It seems as if every other game winds up dwindling down to one possession. It’s been written about with some frequency that this team finds a way to grind out a close loss.

item.title: Gathering Historical NFL Weather Data
item.description: Warmish Welcome Fantasy sports are a passion of mine because they reside at the intersection of two of my favorite things in the world: sports and data. Over the last 4 or so years, I have built data sets suitable for modeling fantasy football and basketball outcomes. I tend to favor daily fantasy, but weather data is valuable for season long fantasy football as well. In fantasy football, weather data are valuable for a variety of reasons.
